p: The DPPH and ABTS assays demonstrated a significant antioxidant activity for all Pinaceae EOs. P. mugo EO was the more active with an IC 50 3.08 ± 0.65 and 43.08 ± 6.95 µg/mL for DPPH and ABTS assays, respectively. The values expressed in Trolox equivalent (TEAC) confirmed identical results. A comparative investigation has been carried out on P. halepensis EO chemical composition and antioxidant activities, with respect to the impact of geographic variation and environmental conditions [ 61].
